programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: The first of three programmes exploring the most inhospitable places on the planet and the people who live there, including a team of Sherpa roping a route on Mount Everests notorious Khumbu Icefall and, on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, farmers fight pitched battles to save their crops from marauding elephants. In the Amazon rainforest, two boys undergo a rite of passage involving hundreds of ants with the most painful stings on Earth, and conservationists in the Grand Canyon try to ensure the survival of one of Americas few surviving condor chicks

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri travel to Georgian mansion of Tatton Park in Cheshire, where Bendor has spotted a mysterious portrait of a 16th-century physician in its collection

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson oversees another duel of words and wit as Patrick Campbell, Hannah Gordon and Charles Gray compete against Frank Muir, Angela Rippon and Tim Rice. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against panellists Valerie Pitts, David Attenborough and Tony Lewis. With guest musician Steuart Bedford. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Anthony Wall Remembers - Arena
programme.desc: When young music journalist and radio trainee Anthony Wall joined the BBC Arena team in 1978 he had no idea what lasting impact this documentary arts strand would have on his life and career. Under the guidance of then series editor Alan Yentob, and working alongside director Nigel Finch, films such as My Way, Desert Island Discs and The Private Life of the Ford Cortina would breathe new life into arts programming in the UK. As Arena celebrates its 50th anniversary, Anthony looks back fondly on his time as producer, director and longest-running series editor, celebrating the films and people that made it ground-breaking, unmissable and unforgettable TV

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1979 edition of the arts documentary exploring the appeal and power of Paul Ankas song My Way, most famously associated with Frank Sinatra, but which has also been recorded by such diverse artists as Elvis Presley, Shirley Bassey and Sid Vicious. With contributions from Anka himself, George Brown, Dorothy Squires and Barry John

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 2012 profile of the writer, from impoverished schoolmaster whose first novel Lord of the Flies was published when he was 43, through to his winning the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1983, to his death 10 years later. The film has unprecedented access to his unpublished diaries, in which he recorded his dreams - revealing his private obsessions and insecurities. The authors children, Judy and David, speak frankly about their fathers demons, while other contributors include playwright Nigel Williams and author Stephen King. Benedict Cumberbatch reads extracts from Goldings work

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: A 1997 edition of the arts documentary exploring the cultural significance of the fruit, including musician John Cale telling the story behind Andy Warhols cover for the Velvet Undergrounds debut allbum. Auberon Waugh and John Walters recall their first encounters with bananas after the war and former footballer Brendan Batson considers how they became a symbol of racism when hurled at black players from the terraces

programme.title: Britains Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri travel to Georgian mansion of Tatton Park in Cheshire, where Bendor has spotted a mysterious portrait of a 16th-century physician in its collection

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against panellists Valerie Pitts, David Attenborough and Tony Lewis. With guest musician Steuart Bedford. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: The first of three programmes exploring the most inhospitable places on the planet and the people who live there, including a team of Sherpa roping a route on Mount Everests notorious Khumbu Icefall and, on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, farmers fight pitched battles to save their crops from marauding elephants. In the Amazon rainforest, two boys undergo a rite of passage involving hundreds of ants with the most painful stings on Earth, and conservationists in the Grand Canyon try to ensure the survival of one of Americas few surviving condor chicks

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Documentary profiling some of the worlds most expansive - and inhospitable - landscapes, and the people who live there. A fisherman in Zambia faces off against crocodiles and risks being swept to his death as he tries to make a living above the imposing Victoria Falls, and in the Amazon, a giant fish offers salvation to a hungry family that calls the river home. A boys future hangs on the outcome of a single horse race in the vast grasslands of the Steppe, and in a European salt marsh, a young man duels with a savage bull in a centuries-old battle of wills

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Barbara is persuaded to speak to a womens group about her self-sufficient lifestyle - and soon finds herself in great demand. Vintage comedy, with Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal, featuring guest appearances by Robert Lindsay and Angela Thorne

programme.title: Yes Minister
programme.desc: Sir Humphrey is horrified when Jim decides to support the sale of an art gallery to save the football club in his constituency from going under. Comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Revisiting the African lions that learned to prey on elephants in the drought-ridden Kalahari Desert, and catching up with the pride during the rainy season. Imogen Stubbs narrates

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Writer and comedian Michael Palin takes a train ride from Derry to Kerry, trying to dispel a few myths about Irish rail travel and learn about the emigrants who left for America during the famines of the 1840s. He climbs aboard the so-called peace train, operated jointly by Northern Ireland Railways and Irish Rail, a service which has come to symbolise cross-border co-operation

programme.title: Michael Palin: The Art of Travel
programme.desc: The actor looks back at a century-old rail service to St Andrews, where the LNERs publicity department of the 1920s and 1930s promoted an industrial service alongside familiar holiday resorts. From 1989

programme.title: Comic Roots
programme.desc: A 1983 documentary in which the actor discusses his early interest in acting and comedy, reflecting on his education at the Shrewsbury School and Oxford University. First broadcast 12 August 1983

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Detailed account of the bloody uprising at a New York State prison in 1971. Over 1,000 inmates took control of Attica Correctional Facility, seizing 39 hostages in the process. Their demands related mainly to the inhumane conditions they were forced to endure, but a huge police assault and a hail of gunfire killed 29 convicts and 10 innocents, an action that has left many survivors, both guards and inmates, seeking compensation

programme.title: Dan Cruickshank and the Family That Built Gothic Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the changing fortunes of a family of architects, following the rise and fall of George Gilbert Scott, his son George Junior, and grandson Giles. Presenter Dan Cruickshank finds out how the dynasty was responsible for the creation of iconic landmarks such as the Midland Hotel at St Pancras station, and helped shape the Victorian age with their designs

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Writer and comedian Michael Palin takes a train ride from Derry to Kerry, trying to dispel a few myths about Irish rail travel and learn about the emigrants who left for America during the famines of the 1840s. He climbs aboard the so-called peace train, operated jointly by Northern Ireland Railways and Irish Rail, a service which has come to symbolise cross-border co-operation

programme.title: Earths Natural Wonders

A fisherman in Zambia faces off against crocodiles and risks being swept to his death as he tries to make a living above the imposing Victoria Falls, and in the Amazon, a giant fish offers salvation to a hungry family that calls the river home. programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: SAS: Catching the Criminals
programme.desc: Billy Billingham discovers how police forces are using military tactics. The first episode focuses on the hunt for a drug kingpin operating in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the stories of three renovation projects on properties in Wednesbury in the West Midlands, Dunvant in Swansea and Norwich

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Stoneleigh antiques fair in Warwickshire where Caroline Hawley and Tim Weeks help two teams search for collectibles to take to auction. Tara and Owain on the red team search for papery things and come across a cranberry glass vase while Sophie and Jenny on the blue team are drawn to an art deco silver bar brooch

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Mark Wright, Maxine Dwyer and Asher Edwards, along with a team of helpers, help Jess make space in her home for her brother and her boyfriend to move in. Maxine gets to work on the wardrobe while Asher builds a bespoke desk and vinyl storage. The team transform the spare room into an office and reimagines the lean-to as a living space for Jesss brother Stuart

programme.title: Robson Greens Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson, his nephew Daymon, brother David and uncle Matheson clamber into a camper van and head south to County Durham. The first stop sees them don wetsuits to have a go at white water tubing in an extremely cold river

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah is house-hunting in Somerset with a couple from New York, offering up a striking long house and a converted water mill

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: James Broad and Lauren Wood help Sue sell some of her cherished collections to help fund a special holiday with her daughters and grandchildren. Lauren hopes to make a sensitive repair to a pair of masks made by Asante tribespeople in Ghana and restores a Victorian tea caddy thats been turned into a money box. James uncovers an impressive array of silverware and an RAF-embossed powder compact that Sues dad gifted to her mum during the war

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show in which three couples face a series of 50/50 questions that hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Angela Rippon

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Slaters are still in shock from last nights ordeal - but they remain suspicious when Zoe continues to evade the truth. Sharon arrives back in Walford and is surprised to see Zoe, Cindy causes tension between Lauren and Peter and an accident at the Albert leads to Mos firing

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Architect Patrick Bradley heads to Ballymena where he meets retired couple Stephen and Marie who are on a mission to restore a row of derelict cottages into their new family home. The project soon faces a a major hurdle, the original thatched roof from the 1800s is beyond repair and most of the structure is no longer viable

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: As the UK and others prepare to officially recognise a Palestinian state at the United Nations, Panorama and BBC Eye investigate the desperate shortages of food in Gaza and the allegations of war crimes. With Israel on the verge of expanding its military campaign in the Gaza Strip and blaming Hamas for the shortages of food there, Jeremy Bowen asks what all this means for the million or so Palestinians who now face being displaced from their homes in Gaza City, and for those facing the prospect of fleeing again

programme.title: The Guest
programme.desc: Ria finds herself a fugitive on the run. She must stay one step ahead of the police - and Fran - long enough to repair old relationships and discover the evidence that will clear her

programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Trying
programme.desc: Nikki and Jason attend an adoption support picnic and are alarmed at the different achievements of members of the group. Developing an inferiority complex, they come to realise that these are not the people they need to impress.

programme.title: Trying
programme.desc: Hung over after a night out, Nikki and Jason are horrified to realise they have forgotten that Penny from the adoption agency is arriving for a home visit and pull out all the stops to impress her

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Roy Wood Jr hosts this edition from November 2024 in which broadcaster Richard Osman and comedian Roisin Conaty join Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the US election results

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The film show may be over but the raw emotions seem likely to continue long after. The couples split into two groups and head off for days out on separate islands - unaware that castaways, some of whom are all too familiar, plan to gatecrash their parties. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island
programme.desc: The events of castaway day cause a tidal wave across Honeymoon Island. A crate washes up to give the honeymooners some much-needed support from home, before one husband is left with a shocking decision to make. Presented by Davina McCall

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: After years of sacrifice to care for his mother, Ralphs living room doubled as his bedroom, leaving him ashamed to host friends. Mark Wright, Maxine Dwyer and Tommy Walsh work their magic on the property, with Maxine expertly cleaning and decluttering and Tommy designing a stylish media wall. Together, they give Ralph his living room and bedroom back, restoring both function and pride into his home

programme.title: Robson Greens Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson travels to the south of the Lake District to meet his friend Helen Skelton, who gets a surprise when the actor takes her on a walk among wolves in their natural habitat, after which they relax with a meditation session. Back on his own, Robson heads to a disused quarry for an unforgettable scuba diving experience

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A young couple want to swap their London flat for something bigger in the East Midlands, where Nicki Chapman opens the front doors to a selection of homes with charming gardens. Nicki cant miss the opportunity to meet another young couple whove already made their escape to develop a luxury leather goods business

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.sub-title: Big Buddhas and Tiny Tea Pots
programme.desc: James Broad sets out to raise as much money as possible for a woman diagnosed with Alzheimers, sorting through Chinese collectibles, many of which came from her husbands relatives, delicate porcelain, rugs and paintings. Meanwhile, Lauren Wood finds that restoring a table is no easy task

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon offers Phil an olive branch after an awkward encounter, while Vicki and Zoe have an altogether more violent encounter in the Square. Howie gets a job delivering parcels, and Cindy is impressed by the initiative of Jasmine, a girl applying for a job at the Albert

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: A Couple of Eggs Short of an Omelette
programme.desc: Zachs 17th birthday proves a nostalgic time for Stacey as she remembers she was the same age when she became his mum. Its also bake-off time for Stacey and Joe as they compete to come up with best lemon drizzles for the occasion. Joe hops on a plane to see his mum in Andalusia, while back home, Stacey plots her latest animal takeover of the garden

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: The classroom drama returns for a new term. Headteacher Stella is forced to navigate a fresh set of challenges when her estranged grandchildren land at the school. New teacher Darius Donovan (played by comedian Jon Richardson) is soon shaking things up in the staffroom, while Jack Rimmer finds himself tackling the troubles of a new generation as he returns as school counsellor. Schuey and Agnes cause uproar when they rebel against Stellas new rules

programme.title: BBC News at Ten

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Donte is plunged into crippling debt, so Ashton takes drastic measures to pull his dad out of this latest crisis. Stella and grandson Ben clash as the school welcomes a cohort of year six students and Debs is excited to step into Wendys shoes for the day, but Nicky is forced to step in when things get out of hand. Jack tries to help Libby settle back into school life when she clashes with Aleena

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island

programme.title: Horrible Histories

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A Victorian businessman goes undercover in his own factory, there is an argument over who rules medieval England and the Real Tudor Hustle reveals cons by historical criminals

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. James May joins Margaret Calvert, one of Britains road-sign designers, to test-drive the Vauxhall Insignia VXR, and Richard Hammond tries out a £340,000 Lexus supercar. Blues musician Seasick Steve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Journalist Tir Dhondy investigates the disappearance of Sarm Heslop, who went missing from a luxury Caribbean charter yacht in 2021. Tire retraces Sarms last known movements and tracks down two boat captains whose vessels were moored near the yacht she vanished from. Also, she gets to question Ryan Banes, Sarms boyfriend, account of what happened what happened through his lawyer David Cattie

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy meets with island police and is given CCTV footage that has never been released, showing Sarms last known movements with her boyfriend, Ryan Bane

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from, and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. James May joins Margaret Calvert, one of Britains road-sign designers, to test-drive the Vauxhall Insignia VXR, and Richard Hammond tries out a £340,000 Lexus supercar. Blues musician Seasick Steve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Comedy, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan, following one mans quest for attention from anyone wholl give it to him. After splitting up with Guy, Jamma is now between jobs and sleeping on Winnies sofa. However, when he unexpectedly sees Guy for the first time in six months at Isaacs pop-up art exhibition, the spark between the exes is undeniable. To Jamma and Guys surprise a handsome stranger takes a special interest in their relationship status. With Russell Tovey

programme.title: Juice
programme.desc: Guys double-booked himself, so asks Jamma to house-sit and let a builder in. Jamma finds Guys manuscript about exes, but on discovering hes not included is sent into a spiral. Isaac comes over to calm Jamma down, but the pair discover Saif pampering himself in the house. Farida arrives with divorce papers and a new showbiz career to show off about. Sitcom, written by and starring Mawaan Rizwan and Russell Tovey

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Journalist Tir Dhondy investigates the disappearance of Sarm Heslop, who went missing from a luxury Caribbean charter yacht in 2021. Tire retraces Sarms last known movements and tracks down two boat captains whose vessels were moored near the yacht she vanished from. Also, she gets to question Ryan Banes, Sarms boyfriend, account of what happened what happened through his lawyer David Cattie

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy meets with island police and is given CCTV footage that has never been released, showing Sarms last known movements with her boyfriend, Ryan Bane

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from, and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott delves into the dark economy that keeps the drugs flowing in Ibiza, meeting with the drug supplier who never deals on the streets but feeds a seemingly never-ending supply of Class A drugs to demanding clientele all over the island. She also speaks to the police officers on the front line who are trying to cope with the excessive drug use, often allowing users with small supplies to walk away in order to target the dealers in the act of selling. Officers explain how social media has made their jobs much more difficult and Zara follows as they raid a luxury car rental company next to the main airport

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: DI Bones investigates a Victorian traffic accident, Roman scientist Pliny the Elder suffers a stupid death in ancient Pompeii and the history of Australia is revealed

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Brian the handsome scientist reveals the wonders of the Greek universe and fast-talking pensioner Bob Hale tries to explain the space race between America and the USSR

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of a Reliant Robin to investigate the reasons behind the lack of three-wheeled cars on the market. The Stig takes the Bentley Continental Supersports for a spin around the test track, and James May fires up the Toyota Hilux for a final challenge - a gruelling drive up Eyjafjallajokull, an active Icelandic volcano that halted flights in British airspace in 2010

programme.title: Red Eye
programme.desc: A hotel manager overcomes her fear of flying and boards a busy late-night flight to Miami, seating herself next to the seemingly friendly man she met in the airport. However, once the plane leaves the ground, she discovers her fellow passenger is a terrorist intent on involving her in an assassination plot. Wes Cravens suspense thriller, starring Rachel McAdams, Cillian Murphy and Brian Cox

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: After African American photographer Chris and his white girlfriend Rose visit her wealthy parents, he suspects theres more to the locals than meets the eye. Oscar-winning psychological thriller written and directed by Jordan Peele (Us), starring Daniel Kaluuya, Allison Williams, Bradley Whitford and Caleb Landry Jones

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The writer and actor tours the UK in his campervan, exploring local legends, myths and folklore and gathering evidence in a bid to get to the truth. He begins by going in search of Black Shuck, the demon dog of East Anglia, attempting an overnight stakeout to capture it on film, with unexpected consequences

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The writer and actor heads to Wiltshire, home to ancient sites such as Stonehenge, Avebury and the Westbury chalk horse, to get to the bottom of why humans feel the need to leave marks on the landscape. He turns his investigation towards the far more recent phenomenon of crop circles, hoping to settle a debate that has plagued his family for years. They think that crop circles are the work of aliens, but Charlie strongly doubts that belief

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.desc: Professional boxer Ewans fighting career hits a stumbling block, while Shane makes a big error with Carmens name plate. Over at the salon Sammyjos workload takes its toll and Molly proves she has been underestimated by her fellow Longlox girls

programme.title: Angels of the North
programme.sub-title: A Lot Can Happen in Two Months
programme.desc: With Jade off sick, Shane is stretched at Pure Ink - and he ends up missing a detail. In Jarrow, Ewan and the boys are focused on the future, while at Longlox theres a major makeover and Sammyjos life changes in a big way

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Brothers, flatmates and polar opposites Samir and Nikhil find themselves on an adventure when they accidentally steal a package from their maniac neighbour. Short, one-off comedy, starring Karan Gill, Ikky Kabir, Eshaan Akbar, Elina Saleh, Ed Kear and Andrea Valls

programme.title: Ibiza: Secrets of the Party Island
programme.desc: Zara McDermott meets Spains top lawyer when it comes to defending drug traffickers, Ricardo Alvarez-Ossorio, and joins the Spanish Civil Guard as they tackle organised crime and drug trafficking across the country. While on a night shift with an ambulance crew, Zara speaks to a nurse who explains how Ibiza is the ideal testing ground for new drugs

programme.desc: The Teletubbies play choo-choo and follow the Tubby Custard Machine on a Tubby Custard Ride. Plus, in Tummy Tales, children follow their nursery teacher to the local playground

programme.title: Maddie and Triggs

programme.title: Dylans Playtime Adventures
programme.desc: Dylan the detective is on the case and wants to solve another mystery. So, when his wagon goes missing, hes hot on the trail

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Timmy tries to complete his chores quickly so he can go outside to play, but ends up making more mess and getting into trouble

programme.title: Aneeshwar and Lizzie Go Wild
programme.desc: Aneeshwar and Lizzie head to a safari park to meet a herd of zebras. They reveal that a zebras stripes are unique to each individual

programme.desc: We meet Brandon, a ballet dancer, who uses his fabulous foot roller to help his feet to relax after a lot of dancing

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Meagaidh the Border Collie is a search and rescue dog who works with her owner Tom. Her supernose follows scents and smells like clues, so they can rescue people who need their help. Joe and his daughter Kate are in trouble at the top of a really steep hill. They are lost, cold, soggy, tired and hungry. And theyve dropped their picnic bag down a hill. Joe manages to contact Tom at the Woofton Search and Rescue Centre, just before the battery on his phone runs out. Now, Tom and Meagaidh must race to find them! Meagaidh leads the way, avoiding the sheep, the muddy puddles and the rocks. She soon finds Joes picnic bag, which gives her and Tom the scent they need. Together, they set off up the hill to find Joe and Kate. Just wait until Dog Squad hears about their adventure!

programme.title: Maddies Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie learns how digger tracks help it move and she finds out how wellies are made

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first host of the week, Andy, is hoping his guests enjoy the seaside at Sefton Blackpool. But a shocking discovery at breakfast leaves all of the BandBers nonplussed

She gambles everything by making all her food from scratch - but with steak on the menu, can she sear to everyones liking and hit the jackpot to bag the grand?

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Almería, mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun Garner catch up with Geoff and Anita, who back in 2019 wanted to swap their Southend-on-Sea coastal life for Spanish inland country views. Meanwhile on the Costa Blanca in the province of Alicante, husband and wife Damon and Sophie Rodriguez are back to meet ex-airforce duo Eileen and Martin, who back in 2018 were looking to retire to the sun

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Jamie: Eat Yourself Healthy
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how he incorporates more white fish into his diet, by serving up cod in crispy filo pastry and a sensational tomato orzo. Next, he combines calcium-rich tofu with mushrooms containing vitamin D to deliver a crowd-pleasing stew with dumplings, and cooks up prawn curry using chickpeas and sweet mango. Plus, the latest science about how protein could help keep energy levels stable

programme.title: The Inheritance
programme.desc: As the Deceaseds devious game nears its dramatic conclusion, the players are pushed to their limits and forced to adapt their strategies and sharpen their instincts in order to survive. programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Fifteen-year-old James comes in after being struck in the eye with an arrow during an archery class. Dr Ian, who treats him, shares his neurodiversity experience from childhood and the difficulties he faced growing up. Fifty-year-old joiner Chris has a wound to his head after a work accident, he shares his injuries and treatment with his many social media followers

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Connor is rushed in after a motorbike accident leaving him with leg and lung injuries. Sixty nine-year-old Rob, who has locked-in-syndrome, is admitted into resus after his breathing tube becomes dislodged leaving him unable to breathe properly. In minor injuries, 58-year-old Lisa receives treatment for an injured wrist

programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: Year sevens Ismaeel, an enthusiastic ball of energy with his sights set on becoming a student representative for his year, canvasses classmates in the school playground, taking his list to school head Mr Burton who agrees to his real passion project - launching a brand-new chess club. Specialist teacher Mrs Burton is determined to help Lewis in year nine, a star student who was diagnosed with autism at the age of eight, come up with inventive ways to build his confidence - including the new chess club. Assistant Head Mrs Delaney-Hudson is determined not to give up on bright and charming year eight student Jacob who struggles to stay put in lessons

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice

Meanwhile, Phil Ellis finds something surprising inside a fake fish and Ania Magliano makes a startling revelation. As ever Little Alex Horne does his level best to maintain a little decorum

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Part one of two. Hard-nosed owner Julie finds herself completely at odds with the head chef, forcing her to breaking point

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp are in south-east London with two couples for whom timing is critical. In and around the Isle of Dogs and Greenwich, Lia and Andrew have saved a big deposit and have a sizeable budget of £600,000 to spend. But, after witnessing the crash of 2008, Andrew is nervous of spending his hard-earned money for fear the market will dip. Lucy and Dan live in a BandB and if they dont find somewhere soon their vintage campervan will become their home. programme.desc: Some of Britains best-loved personalities, join forces to critique the weeks biggest TV shows. programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes including The Inheritance, Long Lost Family, Unknown Number: The High School Catfish, The Yorkshire Vet, Dish It Out and Street Cops: Catching the Yobs. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his two-part challenge at Mangia Mangia in Woodland Park, Colorado. programme.title: Undercover Boss USA

programme.title: The Donald Trump Show
programme.desc: A novel take on the US presidents second term in office, recutting archive news clips as drama to retell Trumps story. The second episode focuses on President Trump as he pursues an ambitious agenda to transform America. Hes learned his lessons from his first term and seems not to be allowing anyone or anything to get in his way, breaking with the democratic norms the country was founded on. As he takes on the media, the press and the universities while ensuring that he keeps US borders secure, Trumps sends the National Guard to Los Angeles and Washington DC

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.sub-title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes: Season by Season
programme.desc: Springtime is a time of new life - its a time where the Dales and the Lakes flourish. In Grasmere, sheep farmers Peter and Robert Bland are marking up their new lambs, before setting them and their mothers free on the open fell. On the Castle Bolton Estate in the Dales, head gamekeeper Ian Sleightholm and his children offer a hand to licenced bird ringer David Baines, as they capture and ring chicks no longer so common across the country. Because of Ians management of the moor, species such as the lapwing, curlew and merlin have found a haven. In Wensleydale, a private woodland has become a sanctuary for another rare British breed - the red squirrel

Paddy Green ends up in a dangerous high-speed pursuit with a motorist he attempted to ticket for using a mobile phone while driving

programme.title: Fare Dodgers: At War with the Law
programme.desc: At Hayes, investigators trail a man they believe has racked up nearly £2,500 in unpaid fares by fraudulently making contactless payments with a rogue bank card to cheat the system. The investigators track him to his home station where they identify him on CCTV, eventually catch him in the act, and interview him. At Waterloo, Jack and Sam tackle passengers using railcards they are not entitled to, while in Southampton, Spencer stops a woman pushing through the barriers and finds she is lying about her age and using a child discount card

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: Officers confront a nuisance rider who refuses to go quietly after his electric scooter collided with a car, while police are stretched to their limit while dealing with a number of fights in the city centre. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Just outside Ripley, Derbyshire, officers head to a set of roadworks following a tip-off that a driver is suspected of regularly driving to and from his place of work under the influence of drink. When they arrive, they arrest a workman who is not only aggressive and appears to be drunk, but is wanted for being in breach of a court order, so is taken into custody. Police also tackle a surge in thefts from lorries, boxing in and intercepting a couple of known offenders with a history of burglary

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: An international DJ who has learned some new things about her sexuality after a recent holiday to Ibiza now has to get to grips with Londons same-sex dating scene - which is not easy when her first date is someone she previously blanked on a dating app. A man with deteriorating vision and a desire to start a family is paired with a trombone player, while other candidates include a full-time carer and a medical student looking to date outside her profession

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words
programme.desc: Lisa learns she is good at crossword puzzles and enters a city-wide contest. Homer opens a break-up service after discovering he has a flair for letting loved ones down, but gets himself into trouble with his daughter when he places a bet against her in the competition

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa takes a trip to the mall to buy a new gadget, while Bart manages to cause chaos. After making a hasty retreat, he befriends a boy named Bashir - but Homer begins to believe that his sons new pal is involved in a terrorist plot

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonards purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After arguing with Sheldon, Howard tries to make amends by taking him to Nasas headquarters in Houston. Elsewhere, Penny has second thoughts about quitting her job as a waitress when her car dies, while Amy tries to find Raj a date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Tony feels disheartened behind bars, but will the return of a familiar face help? Meanwhile, a secret becomes too heavy for one resident to hold

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Featuring a variety of cats doing strange things, soldiers stuck in the sand and a dog balancing on a rope

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Boca Raton in Florida to turn around the fortunes of Italian restaurant Anna Vincenzos. The owner opened the establishment in 2001 with the help of her father but the business has failed to meet her expectations, and the chef realises that her ruthless style of management is having an adverse influence, not only on her staff but also on her family

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: While one bride makes a showstopping entrance, another suffers a major wedding day wobble. Meanwhile, the first set of newlyweds jet off on their honeymoons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. His night alone with Bernadette goes badly, his mother ignores him, and he realises Stuart has taken his place as Rajs best friend. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group games night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil tries to be romantic when the family goes on holiday to Hawaii, and Jay realises it will not be as relaxing as he had hoped. Elsewhere, Mitch and Cam cannot decide whether to go sightseeing, and the children run riot. Comedy, starring Ty Burrell and Ed ONeill

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claires plans for a family portrait do not go smoothly, and Cameron reveals his inner diva. Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Eric Stonestreet

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys invite the girls to a Dungeons and Dragons night when their trip to Vegas falls through after an incident with airport security. However, following a few drinks, Sheldon and Amys relationship takes an unexpected turn. Meanwhile, Raj goes on a date with Lucy, who tries to sneak out of the restaurants bathroom window - but ends up getting stuck and calling for his help

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is offered an exciting job opportunity, but it will mean he has to leave the country for several months. Penny tries to support his ambitions, while Sheldon is jealous and attempts to discourage him from accepting the post. Meanwhile, Raja pushes the boundaries with Lucy, but puts their relationship in jeopardy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town biology convention. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Diaz tries to soothe Jeffords ego after a professional setback. Meanwhile, Santiago spends some precious time with Captain Holt. Crime comedy, starring Andy Samberg

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jeffords wants to file an official complaint against a fellow police officer who stops him in his own neighbourhood while he is off duty, but Captain Holt has other ideas. Peralta and Santiago glimpse the difficulties of parenthood when they babysit for Jeffords children

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes a doting father and decides to spend quality time with his youngest daughter when he discovers Santas Little Helper knows Maggie better than he does. Meanwhile, a lonely Moe joins an online dating agency, and gets a pleasant surprise when he meets an attractive woman

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
programme.desc: Bart is on his best behaviour as he tries to win the affections of a girl at his school, while Lisa reports on what Springfield will look like in 50 years. With the voice of Anne Hathaway (Les Miserables)

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: While one bride makes a showstopping entrance, another suffers a major wedding day wobble. Meanwhile, the first set of newlyweds jet off on their honeymoons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer accidentally kills a legendary alligator while on holiday in Florida, so he and the family go on the run to escape the terrible punishment they are convinced awaits them, adopting new identities and taking jobs in a cafe. Featuring the guest voice of Kid Rock

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A film about a sexy tango expert inspires Lisa to take up dancing, but she discovers she is not very good at it. Bart and Milhouse skip summer camp to avoid school bully Nelson and end up hiding in the local shopping centre, making Chief Wiggum believe it is infested with huge rats

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Peri finds comfort in Tom as sparks fly during their date. Sienna decides to do whatever it takes to escape. And residents are heartbroken by a shocking theory about Robbie

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Those taking part include 23-year-old Rory, who meets 24-year-old Ella, along with 54-year-old self-confessed man-eater Caroline, who has been on 50 dates in the past two years. Tattoo enthusiast Adam returns to First Dates hoping to romance 30-year-old single mum Laura, who is yet to meet a man who accepts she has a child. Urologist Abi may know all about the male anatomy, but realises her job can scare off some men

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Another pair of singles walk down the aisle, but could a frosty first impression leave one bride out in the cold on her wedding night? And as the honeymoons continue, one couples romance goes from strength to strength

programme.title: Bring It!
programme.desc: Reality series following coach Dianna Williams, aka Miss D, and her young dance troupe from Mississippi. The Dancing Dolls prepare to compete against a fierce rival, but Dianna forbids a number of dancers from participating at the event after less-than-perfect performances

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes two more singletons to choose a date from a selection of six naked people, who are revealed to them one body part at a time. Six-foot pansexual opera singer Clare is looking for a man as tall as she is, while Jessica, who has a disastrous dating history, hopes to bring out her naughty side

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A retired racing driver meets a champion ballroom dancer, and a school caretaker returns to the restaurant after his first visit ended in tears. A model for an adult TV station reflects on how her line of work has affected her love life before meeting a leather-clad fitness photographer, and a deaf dog groomer has a date with a stablehand

programme.title: The Winslow Boy
programme.desc: The father of a Navy cadet accused of theft goes to great lengths to restore his sons tarnished reputation. Historical courtroom drama based on a play by Terence Rattigan, starring Robert Donat, Margaret Leighton, Cedric Hardwicke and Basil Radford.

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: The ruler of the Persian empire vows to expand his realm by conquering Greece. The king of Sparta steps forward to defend his homeland and the other kingdoms of Greece, but when he is betrayed by a political council, he finds himself without an army and must fend off the vast invading army with a mere 300 warriors. Historical drama, starring Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson and Diane Baker

programme.title: The Devil at 4 OClock
programme.desc: A priest is sent to a South Seas island to replace a drunken missionary, who has been relieved of his duties. Sharing his flight are three convicts being sent to work at a childrens leper hospital. The five men must work together to protect the young patients when a volcano erupts, leaving them stranded with no easy way out. Adventure, starring Spencer Tracy, Frank Sinatra and Kerwin Mathews

programme.title: Midway
programme.desc: The story of the Battle of Midway, a clash between the American fleet and the Imperial Japanese Navy, which marked a pivotal turning point in the Pacific Theatre during the Second World War. When US intelligence intercepts messages detailing a Japanese attack on an unnamed location, it becomes a race against time to both figure out where will be hit next and how to prepare for an impending battle. Roland Emmerichs drama, starring Ed Skrein, Patrick Wilson, Woody Harrelson and Luke Evans

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Team America: World Police
programme.desc: An American counter-terrorism unit travels around the world on the lookout for threats to global peace, causing much destruction to major world cities in the process. The biggest current menace is North Korean leader Kim Jong-il and an organisation much closer to home - the Film Actors Guild. Satirical puppet comedy, voiced by South Park creators Trey Parker and Matt Stone

programme.title: Antwone Fisher
programme.desc: A troubled Navy recruit is prone to violent outbursts and is ordered to see a psychiatrist, who gradually helps the mentally scarred sailor to come to terms with his past and abusive childhood. Fact-based drama, directed by and starring Denzel Washington. With Derek Luke, Joy Bryant and Salli Richardson

programme.title: All the Kings Men
programme.desc: A small-town senator wins popular support by railing against the corruption of the political establishment and vowing to defend the interests of ordinary working people. However, once in office, he succumbs to greed as readily as those he once so virulently condemned. Political drama, starring Broderick Crawford, Joanne Dru, John Ireland and Mercedes McCambridge

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter was born deaf and mute decide to enrol her in a special class in the hope that she might learn to speak. The difficulties they face in raising their child expose the tensions within their marriage. Drama based on the novel The Day Is Ours by Hilda Lewis, starring Phyllis Calvert, Jack Hawkins, Mandy Miller and Terence Morgan

programme.title: The Swimmer
programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by diving into and swimming in the neighbourhood pools along his route. Director Frank Perrys cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: Footsteps in the Fog
programme.desc: A prominent Victorian gentleman thinks he has got away with poisoning his wife, but his shrewd maid knows the sordid truth and uses it to blackmail him. As the killers social standing improves, he realises he has to get rid of the scheming servant once and for all, but his plans to dispose of her lead him into even more danger. Period thriller, with Stewart Granger, Jean Simmons and Bill Travers

programme.title: Cowboys and Aliens
programme.desc: A Wild-West town dominated by a cattle baron comes under attack by invaders from another world. It falls to a mysterious stranger with no memory to unite the townsfolk, a gang of outlaws and an Apache tribe, in a bid to fight back against the aliens, and learn the truth about his own past. Sci-fi Western, with Daniel Craig, Harrison Ford, Olivia Wilde and Sam Rockwell

programme.title: Good Luck to You, Leo Grande
programme.desc: A retired school teacher whose husband has recently died longs to experience the passion that was missing in her marriage. She resolves to get a crash course in pleasure by hiring a charming young sex worker. Comedy drama, starring Emma Thompson and Daryl McCormack

programme.title: Fresh
programme.desc: Noa, a young woman from Portland, Oregon, is fed up with online dating, but a chance meeting with Steve in a supermarket leads to romance. After being invited to his luxury home, Noa discovers her new boyfriend has some unusual appetites. Comedy horror, starring Daisy Edgar-Jones, Sebastian Stan and Jonica T Gibbs

programme.title: The Riot Club
programme.desc: Two first year students at Oxford join an infamous drinking society for the Universitys privileged social elite. When they attend an annual dinner at a local pub, the new arrivals are shocked by how far their friends take their hedonistic lifestyle and contempt for others. Thriller drama based on Laura Wades stage play Posh, starring Sam Claflin, Max Irons and Natalie Dormer

programme.desc: Danny buys a ramshackle country cottage, but a local squire takes special interest in the property and goes to extreme lengths to get his hands on it

programme.title: The Avengers

programme.title: The New Avengers
programme.desc: Important documents need to be transported from London to the United States, so Steed comes up with the idea of using three men with photographic memories instead. The plan seems to be working until enemy agent Juvenator gets hold of a device that can drain information from the human mind. Patrick Macnee stars

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. programme.title: Madeleine McCann: Searching for the Prime Suspect
programme.desc: Eighteen years after vanishing from a holiday apartment in Praia da Luz, Portugal, the mystery of Madeleine McCanns disappearance remains unsolved. German prosecutors recently confirmed that Christian Brueckner, the man theyve long believed responsible, is set to be released from prison with no charges imminent in relation to Madeleines abduction and suspected murder. Criminologist Dr Graham Hill, a former senior Met detective who was in Portugal during the early stages of the investigation, returns to Praia da Luz. He examines the case against the man who remains the prime suspect, and who has consistently denied any involvement in Madeleines disappearance

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: New receptionist Morwenna Newcross (Jessica Ransom) gets off to a bad start after arriving late on her first day, and her hyperactive behaviour leads Martin to believe she is high on drugs. Guest starring Andrew-Lee Potts (Primeval)

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisas hippie mother Eleanor (Louise Jameson) arrives in the village, immediately taking over Martins kitchen to prepare a herbal tonic, which she later gives to the baby to stop his crying. Rural hospital drama starring Anna Madeley, Scott Taylor and Robert Daws

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketons attempts to crack down on crime meet with a violent response and Ginas interest is aroused by a mysterious visitor. Derek Fowlds, Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mike makes a shocking discovery about Jackie, forcing him to re-evaluate his marriage almost before it has begun, while unlikely undertaker Greengrass applies his ingenuity to the task of arranging a funeral with a difference. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr, Fiona Dolman and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Lexi, Debbie and Chas make plans to steal jewellery from Home Farm, while Lisa and Zak are upset to learn about Belles party. Billy tries to explain his actions to Daz.

programme.desc: A drunken Kelly kisses Eli at the jewellery sale, while Chas, Lexi and Debbie carry out their robbery. Jonny realises Paul needs a symbol of his commitment and buys a ring.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Leanne refuses a lunchtime drink with Liam as shes meeting a client - but soon has a change of heart and quits the job altogether, much to the delight of Janice.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Fiz tells John hes the real reason she left Kirk, while Michelle is fed up of having no time alone with Steve, so drops in on him at work with a bottle of wine.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: First episode of the costume drama set in an Edwardian country house in 1912, written by Oscar-winning writer Julian Fellowes. The lives of the Crawley family and Downton Abbeys servants are changed for ever when the sinking of the Titanic leaves the estate without its heir and his son. The arrival of a new valet shocks the staff, who scheme to make his stay as short-lived as possible. Starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: PC Penhale is shocked by the unexpected arrival of his ex-wife Maggie (Julie Graham), who appears to have forgotten that they separated years ago and wants to know why he left her. Eleanor goes on a date with local fisherman Paul Hale, an old friend she has not seen since school, while Martin and Louisa finally agree on a name for their baby - James Henry. With Martin Clunes, John Marquez and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Greengrass attempts to organise Aidensfields car rally - an event guaranteed not to pass without incident. Amid all the preparations, an elderly man is attacked, while Gina finds true love at last. Rural drama, starring Tricia Penrose and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A film crew descends on Aidensfield, filling the vain villagers heads with thoughts of stardom. Greengrass, however, is not lured by the prospect of a cameo role as he is too preoccupied with getting his own back on a disreputable farmer. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Jason Durr and Gareth Thomas

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the death of a pensioner found stabbed on a train at the height of rush hour. The case has a huge impact on Joes home life when his daughter is named as a key witness, and he struggles to maintain a professional distance. The trail leads the team to a quiet Northumberland coastal town where clues appear to lead to one particular street - but why are the residents so reluctant to talk? Starring Brenda Blethyn, with David Leon, Sonya Cassidy, Jon Morrison and Eva Birthistle

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective delves into the past of extreme sports enthusiast Gideon Frane after he plunges from a cliff in a ball of flames. A scan of the files reveals a long list of stalking complaints against an ex, and an anonymous letter to the victim spelling out Burn in Hell is linked to one of her friends. Aided by DC Shepherd and the newly appointed DC Edwards, the team tries to track down Gideons old gang to uncover a lifetime of bullying and an unexpected story of rough justice

programme.title: Nolly
programme.desc: Drama based on the story of Noele Gordon, written by Russell T Davies. The actress has been the star of popular ITV soap Crossroads, as motel owner Meg Mortimer, for 17 years. programme.desc: Everyone is anxious at the arrival of Matthew Crawley, the heir presumptive, but he soon encounters problems settling into his new life in Downton, and his mother Isobel immediately crosses swords with Violet. Meanwhile, butler Carson is mortified to be confronted with his past, and housemaid Gwen seems to have a secret correspondent. Costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville, Dan Stevens, Penelope Wilton, Elizabeth McGovern, Jim Carter and Rose Leslie

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Maggie gets the all-clear from the doctor and decides she will return to Bude, forcing PC Penhale to take desperate measures to persuade her to stay in Portwenn. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: PC Bellamys childhood sweetheart returns to Aidensfield for her mothers funeral and uncovers a dark family secret in the attic, leading to a traumatic encounter with her unbalanced sister. Meanwhile, Greengrasss attempts to make a packet by selling wild rabbits as pets fail dismally. Mark Jordon and Bill Maynard star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A feuding farmers wartime past has explosive consequences, while Greengrass, always eager to make a quick profit, tries to cash in on a prediction for the future of his sidekick David. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is called in when David Kenworthy, the son of a prominent local family, is found murdered on the beach at Whitley Bay. A witness spotted arcade owner Larry Crowe arguing with David on the night of the killing, and a search of the suspects property uncovers a bloodied baseball bat. However, Larry has a cast-iron alibi and its clear he wasnt the only person the victim met that night. A second death then leaves Vera facing mounting pressure to crack the case, and struggling to answer the question of why David was drawn to the seafront on the evening of his fathers retirement. Brenda Blethyn stars in the murder mystery, with David Leon as her trusty sidekick Joe

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victims story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery

programme.title: Nolly

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Château de Montvason, Emma and Paul uncover layers of Second World War history as they take on a very particular type of restoration, but disagree about imperfect plastering

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Château de Thuries, near Toulouse, Jayne and Steve are pulled from pillar to post as they host a residential landscape painting course. Near the Normandy beaches, at Château de Montvason, Emma goes all out to faithfully restore the wartime decor, but Paul struggles to see her historical vision. Chateau shoppers Bart and Sarah continue hunting for their dream French home, visiting one place that brings Sarah to tears, though Bart is worried about the amount of work there is to do. Narrated by Adjoa Andoh

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son team John and Johnny de Bruyne. The fun starts with a character-revealing afternoon of goose-herding, before the participants dress to impress at a formal dinner. John recounts stories of royal connections - which fails to impress hotel managers Mark and Layla. In the morning, as they tuck in to a self-service breakfast, guest Tim decides that DIY doesnt work at Anstey Hall, but when he notes this on his feedback form, John and Johnny accuse him of game-playing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham, where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism. Judging with an extra critical eye are John and Jonny De Bruyne, who received negative feedback from Tim, and a thorough room inspection reveals a dusty porn DVD. Tim tries to encourage his nervous guests to take part in a naked spa experience, but John opts to watch television instead. When feedback is invited, Tim is delighted to discover Mark and Layla would stay again but shocked by the porn film discovery

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Angel Hotel in Coleford, Gloucestershire for the third day of the competition, where a treasure hunt organised by hosts Mark and Layla brings out their guests competitive sides. Meanwhile, there is confusion at breakfast and Laylas manners are criticised

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Higher Gitcombe in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests. Everyone is overwhelmed by the added extras, but naturist Tim is put off by cushions and clutter. After a masterclass in Nordic walking, Lynnie serves up a veg smoothie, which unhealthy eaters Mark and Layla dubiously down in one. Over dinner, Tim challenges his hosts organic niche. And Layla, still smarting from his negative feedback, labels him weird, naked Tim. At breakfast, guests are wary as Tims order goes wrong and Jonny and Layla engage in an eating competition. When feedback is invited, the Jollys are affronted by accusations of special treatment and vow to put the record straight

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition, the owners of Anstey Hall, the Clover Spa and Hotel, the Angel Hotel and Higher Gitcombe meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Having aired their issues, the winners are announced

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw continue their mission to rescue classic cars for their deserving owners. Here, the boys take on a rundown Renault Alpine GTA belonging to David, a former computer technician suffering with ill-health

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw travel to Hampshire to pick up a year 2000 Ford Mondeo belonging to Karl, a widowed father of two who has been hit with three years of tragedy, leaving him unable to restore the car that once belonged to his now-deceased dad

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Oxfordshire for the perfect properties. Reena is looking for a geographical balance between her work in Oxford and her family in the Midlands, after house-hunting on and off for five years she enlists the help of Kirstie in the hope of bringing her search to an end. Tan and Steve live an hour apart and are looking for a place to call their own, Phil has his work cut out searching for the open-plan living space they want in the expensive area they are searching in

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In south London, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search for a flat for first-time buyers Adam and Nicole, and a townhouse for world-record-holding rower Kat. Adam and Nicole live with their respective parents and need help to get them living together under the same roof but their home patch has become a pricey part of town, so theyve saved for their entire adult lives to get a large enough deposit. Theyre nervous about spending all that hard-saved cash, but Kirstie manages to find them some hard-to-resist homes. In 2019 Kat was diagnosed with cancer. After going through chemotherapy and being told she was in remission she wanted a new focus, so she joined an all-female trio for an Atlantic rowing challenge. They beat the previous world record by more than seven days, and Kats next challenge is to put down roots with a townhouse in her beloved south London. Even with a budget of over a million pounds, Phil finds it tough to hit everything on her wishlist in the top spots where she wants to live but once they manage to focus her search on Greenwich, things start to fall into place. A house with potential tugs at Kats heart

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets neurologists Penny Talelli and Mark Edwards, who plan to combine their love of old and contemporary architecture as they transform a derelict Victorian gatehouse in north London. However, the pair soon find themselves struggling to balance their busy working lives alongside project managing the build

programme.title: Ancient Autopsy
programme.desc: Professor Suzannah Lipscomb deep dives into some of the greatest death mysteries of the ancient world, as she turns forensic detective and re-examines the final moments of four of ancient historys most iconic figures. Blending science, history, and compelling detective work, Suzannah is joined by world-renowned forensic pathologist, Dr Richard Shepherd, who deploys cutting-edge digital autopsy technology to reveal trauma, disease, and possible foul play. The pair begin by finding out if Egypts last queen - Cleopatra - was truly killed by a snake. To get to the bottom of it, Suzannah confronts live Egyptian cobras, observes venom extraction, and explores academic theories of political murder. And with Dr Shepherds forensic analysis and detailed examination of Roman records, they reconsider the truth behind one of ancient historys most famous deaths

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: The evolutionary biologist takes a train journey across the worlds oldest and greatest civilisation, starting at the very end of the Ancient Egyptian empire in Alexandria, before heading south to Cairo, Luxor and Aswan. Alice goes deep underground in search of Cleopatra, discovers how the Romans and the Greeks reacted to the treasures of Ancient Egypt and, on a visit to the site of the Lighthouse of Alexandria, she learns how a slave became a sultan and built his own fairy-tale caste

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A category one call comes through for a man bleeding from his ears. But how he got these injuries doesnt ring true for the paramedics. A woman whos recently had bowel surgery is losing blood and needs to go to hospital urgently. A patient is struggling to breathe, but didnt tell her husband as she didnt want to worry him, and now she needs an emergency response

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Eighty-year-old Rose has fluid on her lungs and is having trouble breathing. Her daughters Christine, Sandra and Debbie put on brave faces around her bedside, convincing her that everything will be all right, but in the relatives room theres high emotion as they contemplate life without their mother. Also in resus at Kings College Hospital is Kevin, a 55-year-old trucker who has sustained injuries in a road accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A 39-year-old man is flown to Londons Kings College Hospital after being involved in a head-on collision while driving a friends sports car, and doctors fear his injuries could leave him paralysed. Meanwhile, 21-year-old Thomassine requires treatment following a skateboarding accident and the staff see to Matias, 34, who has been dragged along a station platform by a moving train

programme.title: Ancient Autopsy
programme.desc: Professor Suzannah Lipscomb deep dives into some of the greatest death mysteries of the ancient world, as she turns forensic detective and re-examines the final moments of four of ancient historys most iconic figures. Blending science, history, and compelling detective work, Suzannah is joined by world-renowned forensic pathologist, Dr Richard Shepherd, who deploys cutting-edge digital autopsy technology to reveal trauma, disease, and possible foul play. The pair begin by finding out if Egypts last queen - Cleopatra - was truly killed by a snake. To get to the bottom of it, Suzannah confronts live Egyptian cobras, observes venom extraction, and explores academic theories of political murder. And with Dr Shepherds forensic analysis and detailed examination of Roman records, they reconsider the truth behind one of ancient historys most famous deaths

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team returns to explore the secrets behind mass-produced food, meeting technicians, scientists, factory owners, growers and producers, finding out exactly what goes into the everyday groceries that end up on the supermarket shelves. Jimmy Doherty finds out how Sri Lanka is coping with a looming coconut shortage, while Kate Quilton discovers whether compostables could be the answer to worldwide plastic pollution problem, annd Matt Tebbutt is in Paris to learn why the macaron has such a hefty price tag

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Yorkshire glampsite owner in Italy battles a busy summer season with no staff. A Manchester couple juggle the challenges of having a young family and running a French holiday home. Meanwhile, a couple from Birmingham have fine dining plans in France

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Birmingham couple start a cooking school with a difference in France. A glampsite owner in Italy finds a potential pot of gold on her land and a Staffordshire couple have a devastating start to their new life in Spain

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Trish calls on the help of her friends as she tries to bring light into the interior of her dark medieval property. For Bart and Sarah, it is decision time as they visit a château

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Château de Gere near the border with Spain, Trish tries to combat invading sheep by building a fence, but is more than happy to take a delivery of their fertilising manure for her no-dig garden. Near Cognac, at Château de Brives, wedding season has begun for Sarah and George. While Sarah shows off her new floristry skills George has the important role of MC

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of campsite proprietors battle it out to be named best value, with the competition beginning at Ambers Bell Tent Camping in Mannington, Norfolk, a retro-styled pre-erected campsite where artistic host Amber Wykes challenges her guests to go native with a series of bushcraft trials. Over dinner, guests Derek and Julies opinions on glamping irritate both Amber, and glampsite owners Nick and Sheila. Then back at the tents, brother-and-sister team Russell and Jane arent too impressed with the sleeping arrangements. In the morning, the self-catering breakfast leads to complaints aimed squarely at Amber

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed into luxury glamping lodges by Nick and Sheila Charrington. The guests have little to complain about with the accommodation, but a revelation over dinner changes how they see things. Plus, a treasure hunt organised by the hosts sends one team on a wild goose chase

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day four is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where brother and sister Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a caravan site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site does not sit well with the campers - and the evening entertainment of a fire-eating limbo dancer leaves most of them cold

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The campers meet for the final time to find out what they thought one anothers stay was worth. Amber is offended by Dereks low scoring, while he is thrown by Nick and Sheilas feedback. Russell and Jane have an axe to grind with Derek whose low scoring of their park is made worse by what they see as a personal attack on their hosting, while Nick and Sheila appear to emerge relatively unscathed

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw travel to Rochdale to collect a unique family heirloom: a 1953 Riley RMF. A now-rare, British post-war classic has been handed down from father to son for 70 years. Current owner Richard has been unable to get the Riley up and running, so the boys try to make an automotive dream come true. But theres more to this restoration than meets the eye

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Fuzz Townshend and Tim Shaw travel to Oxfordshire to collect a 1973 Porsche 911 Targa. The run-down car belongs to Ben, whos had the motor for around 35 years. However, due to life getting in the way, and developing early onset dementia, he has been unable to get the car running. Wife Jeannetta and friend Andy hope that Car S.O.S can breathe new life into this old classic

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of discerning house-hunters, each with very strong ideas on what they wanted. The searches may have been tough - in some instances they didnt even make it inside some of the properties - but both have faced even more challenging times since. In 2012, couple Robin and Colin wanted to move outside of London, but only an architectural gem was going to do. In 2014, Lia and Andrew said they were done renting in Londons popular Isle of Dogs, and wanted to buy their own home now they were starting a family

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Northern Ireland where Jennifer has hit a wall climbing the property ladder after selling her semi-detached starter home in Belfast and Tony and Val are looking to relocate from London to County Down

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Matt and Sophie White from Sussex as they build a giant family house of fun for themselves and their children. Going against the norm of designing a serious and practical home, the couples property features a revolving bookcase door, secret dens, hiding places and a firemans pole. Matt uses a steel frame system to allow them to change the layout of the property, and other changes include amending the window shapes and sizes, and adding a half floor to create a James Bond room

programme.title: Our Welsh Chapel Dream
programme.desc: With Capel Salem slowly becoming a home, the next room for transformation is the Victorian-inspired parlour bathroom. Keith and Marj take inspiration from Coventry Cathedral, with Keith making a giant clay candlestick holder, while Marj sets about making her dream lampshade for the bathrooms standard lamp

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: The staff at Kings College Hospital treat patients on Valentines Day, including a 53-year-old psychologist who has injured his shoulder in a motorcycle accident. His partner is abroad and he doesnt want to worry her, so he decides to keep the incident a secret. Also in the AandE department are a man with a bleed on the brain and an elderly widower who has been bitten by his dog

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Eight-year-old Abby has had an accident at a diving pool and needs to have her head and neck scanned for serious injuries. Worried mum Nikki puts on a brave face while doctors perform tests, but dad Scott is stuck hundreds of miles away in Scotland. Meanwhile, Anne and Holton - part of a security team dealing with more than 50 incidents a month - encounter a variety of challenging patients on the night shift at Kings College Hospital in London

programme.desc: A night out ends badly when a young man is involved in a fight. programme.desc: The wise-cracking blue hedgehog, made famous by a series of popular video games on Sega consoles, continues his computer-animated adventures through the Shatterverse. At the end of the first series, the eponymous spiny mammal (voiced by Deven Mack) learnt from black hedgehog Shadow (Ian Hanlin) that the original version of Green Hill no longer exists. Sonic is trapped in a multiverse of mayhem with different iterations of his friends Amy Rose (Shannon Chan-Kent), Knuckles (Adam Nurada), Rouge (Kazumi Evans) and Tails (Ashleigh Ball). Sonic and Shadow must put aside their differences and work together to repair the temporal damage and outwit diabolical scientist Dr Eggman (Brian Drummond)
